bibl.title: Letter from William Crawford Gorgas to Charles E. Magoon, June 2, 1905

div1.p: Gorgas requests assignment of John W. Phillips for duty in the Canal Zone Sanitary Department.

div1.head: Letter from William Crawford Gorgas to Charles E. Magoon, June 2, 1905
div1.opener:
June 2, 1905.
Governor of the Canal Zone,
Ancon, C.Z.
Sir:
div1.p:
I request that the Secretary of War be asked for the detail of Dr.
John W. Phillips, Medical Corps, U.S.A., for duty with the Sanitary Depart-
ment on the Isthmus. I forward at the same time a request from Dr. LaGarde
to be relieved from duty with the Commission. I would like to have the
application for Dr. Phillips go forward as soon as possible so that he
may be here on the ground about the time Dr. LaGarde leaves.

I suggest that Dr. Phillips be not designated to fill any parti-
cular position in the Sanitary Department, but simply for duty with the
Sanitary Department so that he can be used wherever it is most advantageous.
div1.closer: Very respectfully, Chief Sanitary Officer. Copy for Surgeon-General, Washington, D.C.
